examples: Congress balked at putting up the money

definition: to stop short and refuse to proceed
examples: The horse balked at the jump and threw the rider.

definition: to commit a balk (see balk entry 2 sense 1)
to check or stop by or as if by an obstacle : block
examples: … had neither been balked nor been frightened …
… such an age as ours balks no expense …

definition: an occurrence in which a pitcher stops suddenly or makes an illegal movement after starting to throw a pitch
examples: The pitcher was charged with a balk.

definition: failure of a competitor to complete a motion (such as a jump, vault, or dive)
the space behind the balkline on a billiard table
any of the outside divisions made by the balklines
a ridge of land left unplowed as a dividing line or through carelessness
